Title: SimpleCLCL
Description: SimpleCLCL is a simple multiclipboard with a kind of modern style. It is inspired by CLCL (thus the name SimpleCLCL).
HomeWiki:
CODEPLEX IS CLOSING DOWN -> THIS APP IS NOW HOSTED HERE

https://github.com/martinyyyy/SimpleCLCL

What is it?

SimpleCLCL is a simple multiclipboard.
It is inspired by http://www.nakka.com/soft/clcl/index_eng.html (thus the name SimpleCLCL).
It's written in .NET 4.5 and WPF. This is just a quick&dirty project. A lot of code snippets are copy&paste from everywhere including stackoverflow.

Why did you write this?
Easy, I don't like the style of the original one and it is missing a few things I really wanted.

Features
  1. saves up to 150 of your last clipboard entrys (even between restarts)
  2. only supports text (no pics, files. richtext gets stripped to *only* text when inserted using SimpleCLCL)
  3. inserts text only to clipboard
  4. inserts text to clipboard and sends crtl+v to last app
  5. search the clipboard history
  6. tooltip for "too long text" (accessible by mouseover and right-arrow key)
  7. clear history
  8. favorites
  9. rightclick to open a textbox for easier copy of text parts
  10. Run on startup

How to use
  1. ALT+C opens the list of saved clipboard items next to the mouse pointer
  2. select item by cursor, keyboard (up and down key or Shift)
  3. insert into clipboard and output to last app with space or return
  4. only copy to clipboard with crtl+c
  5. begin typing to open search

Smartscreen / Stuck at 100% installation
Windows 10 Smartscreen may prevent the program from running because the executable is not signed by a known authority (this costs money). Click on more info in the dialog and press run anyway to bypass the filter.

Sometimes Smartscreen doesn't even work like intended and doesn't inform the user the program is not known and just crashes. If you see the process "Smartscreen" in your task manager and SimpleCLCL isn't showing up, kill all Smartscreen process and the installation should run to completion.

If Smartscreen keeps on crashing everytime you try to start SimpleCLCL do the following steps.
  1. Open up the Windows setting "Security and Maintaince"
  2. On the left side open Smartscreen and disable it
  3. Kill all Smartscreen processes and SimpleCLCL in task manager
  4. Run SimpleCLCL.application again and uncheck the "ask me everytime...." checkbox.
  5. Enable Smartscreen again
